Finding the Best ' Programmer s Font Becoming frustrated with source code not aligning in my favorite source editor I decided to hunt for the best font. In particular, I began to down hunt the available fixed - width or fonts monospaced. What are monospaced fonts ask you? From Xerox: Monospace fonts (Such as Courier or LetterGothic ), or " fixed pitch " fonts, contain characters that all have the same character width, producing text that can be used to create forms, tabular material or documents that exact require text line lengths. An example of a fixed pitch font is Courier pitch 12, which a is 10 font point that will print at exactly 12 characters per inch. Why use monospaced fonts?
